Cuerpo: 110 Introduction to Computer Programming 1 cr. This course is designed to give engineering students an introduction to a computer programming language, such as Fortran or C. It will cover elementary concepts such as variable type, control structures, loops, and arrays. Emphasis on introduction of algorithms with the use of specific tools to illustrate the methods. 412 Introduction to Numerical Methods 3 cr. 525 Linear Programming Methods 3 cr. 526 Advanced Linear Programming 4 cr. Polynomial time methods for linear programming. 538 Introduction to the Theory and Design of Programming Languages 3 cr. An introduction to basic tools and applications for modeling and analysis of computer systems. The design of computer systems and components. (also ME and IE) Introduction to fundamental geometric computations and algorithms, and their use for solving engineering and scientific problems. 577 Introduction to Algorithms 3 cr. Introduction to principles of advanced programming languages and programming-language theory. 709 Mathematical Techniques for Analysis of Algorithms 3 cr. (also Math) Fundamentals of normed spaces and linear operators; analysis of nonlinear operators; existence of, and iterative methods for, solutions of linear and nonlinear operator equations, error estimation; variational theory and minimization problems; monotonicity theory. 730 Nonlinear Programming Algorithms 3 cr. 747 Advanced Computer Systems Analysis Techniques 3 cr. (also ECE) Introduction to the unique issues in the design and analysis of computer systems for real-time applications. (also ECE) Advanced techniques of computer design. Applications to programming language design.
